h1.span: NOTICE OF POSTPONED BOARD OF TRUSTEES ELECTION

p.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: center;
p.span: Due to COVID-19 restrictions, the May 2, 2020 Pine Tree ISD Board of Trustees Election has been postponed to November 3, 2020.

strong.span: As the Pine Tree ISD family pulls together in support of one another, the PTISD School Counselors want parents and students to know that we are here and ready to assist in any possible manner. If you, the student, or the parent would like to be contacted by a PTISD School Counselor, please complete the attached form and someone will contact you.

p.style: color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: Pine Tree ISD will provide curbside pickup meals to our students beginning Wednesday, March 18 during the closure.
One lunch and the next morning’s breakfast will be provided.

p.style: color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: Please click on the link below for a complete list of distribution sites and times.

span.a: PTISD Student Meal Plan Distribution Sites - English
PTISD Student Meal Plan Distribution Sites - Spanish

p.style: color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; font-size: x-small; text-align: justify; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: #333333;

p.span: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has declared a State of Emergency for the entire State of Texas as a result of the continuing health concerns surrounding Coronavirus or COVID-19. Further, Longview Mayor Andy Mack and the Longview City Council “strongly encourage” actions to limit large group exposure. In an effort to protect the health and safety of all Pine Tree Independent School District (PTISD) students and staff, all classes and school events are suspended until Monday, March 30, 2020.

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; font-size: x-small; text-align: justify; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: #333333;

p.span: School buses will not run nor will there be staff on duty at any campus to receive students until that time.

span.style: font-size: x-small; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: justify; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: #333333;
font-size: x-small; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: justify; font-family: arial, sans-serif;

p.span: Until further notice, all PTISD sponsored events are cancelled. This includes, but is not limited to, all UIL academic events, all UIL athletic events, and all school sponsored field trips. In addition, the PTISD Expedition 2020 scheduled for March 19, 2020, has been rescheduled for Thursday, April 30, 2020 at Maude Cobb.

span.style: font-size: x-small; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: justify; font-family: arial, sans-serif;

p.span: We realize the closure will have an impact on families. Administration is working on plans to provide and deliver meals to students by Tuesday, March 17, 2020, times and stop locations to be determined and shared via local media outlets.

div.style: color: #333333; background-color: #ffffff; padding: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;

span.style: font-size: x-small; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: black;

div.span: District officials from every vantage point are actively monitoring this situation as more information becomes available. We collaborate and rely on factual information from medical experts to guide our decisions making the safety of all concerned top priority. Direction and recommendations come from the most reliable sources such as the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Gregg County Health Department, local health experts, the City of Longview and the Texas Education Agency.

p.style: color: #333333; background-color: #ffffff; padding: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;

span.style: font-size: x-small; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: District officials will continue to monitor and assess information as this situation develops.

span.style: font-size: x-small; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span: A few of our local efforts include access to hand sanitizers and comprehensive sanitizing methods on all buses. The custodial staff continue to provide expert-level cleaning services with their continuous training, quality of products used, and their knowledge of our buildings and systems. Additionally, professionals are coordinating efforts with others regarding student exposures when participating in future extracurricular activities outside of PTISD operations.

div.style: color: #333333; background-color: #ffffff; padding: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;

span.style: font-size: x-small; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: black;

div.style: color: #333333; background-color: #ffffff; padding: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;

span.style: font-size: x-small; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: black;

span.span: PTISD has a Pandemic/Seasonal Illness Preparedness Plan, in effect since September 2019, that proactively addresses how to prevent the spread of infectious illnesses. Many of the precautionary measures included in this document are reiterated by the CDCs recommendation which includes the following personal safety measures:

strong.span: Wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Cover the mouth and nose with the inside of the elbow when coughing or sneezing.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
Avoid touching eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close, large groups and contact with people who are sick.

span.span: Though the situation is unpredictable and concerning, we encourage you to visit the

a.style: color: #009eb8; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: for the most current and reliable information about infectious diseases and how to protect yourselves and your family. Additional information is available at the

a.style: color: #009eb8; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: for questions on how this situation will affect Texas schools, and the most recent information about coronavirus in Texas may be found at the

a.style: color: #009eb8; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
a.span: Texas Department of State Health Services

div.style: color: #333333; background-color: #ffffff; padding: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; text-align: justify;

span.style: font-size: x-small; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: black;

span.span: Please monitor the official district website at

a.style: color: #009eb8; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue Light', HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: and social media accounts; FaceBook, Twitter, and Instagram for timely updates. Local media outlets will share official changes to the school schedule.

span.style: font-size: x-small; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: black;

br.span: We are wholeheartedly committed to providing the best learning environment for the students of Pine Tree, regardless of the challenge.

span.a: What's New in Pine Tree ISD

div.a: Five Pine Tree Students Named to Academic All State Team Swimming and Diving

div.div: The Pine Tree High School Swim team is proud to have placed five students athletes on the All-State Academic Team this year. The Texas High School Coaches Association Academic All-State Teams recogniz...Read more...

div.a: Pine Tree High School Fine Art Students Receive Top Honors at State Visual Arts Scholastic Event

div.div: Eleven Pine Tree Fine Arts students received highest gold medal honors for their amazing artwork, photography, and sculpture entries at the Visual Arts Scholastic Event (VASE). Two photography student...Read more...

div.a: Pine Tree ISD Senior Ashly James Named SemiFinalist in U.S. Presidential Scholars Program

div.div: Ashly James, a graduating senior at Pine Tree High School, has been named one of 621 semifinalists in the 2020 U.S. Presidential Scholars Program. The semifinalists were selected from nearly 5,600 can...Read more...

div.a: Pine Tree UIL Essay Student Rebecca Teixeira Named State Semi-Finalist

div.div: The University Interscholastic League recently named Pine Tree UIL student Rebecca Teixeira a state semi-finalist for the Barbara Jordan Essay contest. Unlike other UIL events, the essay contest requi...Read more...

div.a: Pine Tree ISD Announces 2020-2021 Teachers of the Year

div.div: Pine Tree ISD is proud to announce its 2020-2021 Teachers of the Year as well as its District Elementary and Secondary Teachers of the Year. "I congratulate each of these outstanding teachers for the ...Read more...

div.div:
MISSION
The Pine Tree family champions the relentless pursuit of excellence through a compassionate and safe learning environment empowering all students to develop their unique passions and to make a positive impact in a global society.

p.span:
1701 Pine Tree Road | PO Box 5878 | Longview, Texas 75608
Phone: 903-295-5000 | Fax: 903-295-5004
Business Hours: Monday - Friday | 7:30 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.
